alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; West Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 03 at 10:03PM CDT until June 04 at 1:15AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central East Baton Rouge Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Northeastern West Baton Rouge Parish in southeastern Louisiana... * Until 115 AM CDT. * At 1003 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Heavy rain continues to develop and fall over the area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Baton Rouge, Zachary, Baker, Port Allen, Brownfields, Merrydale, Westminster and Baton Rouge Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 155 and 161. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 5. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 8. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; West Baton Rouge
